description.value:
When you cast this spell, you ward an immobile, hidden location (such as a town, a building, a grotto, or a geographic feature) known only to yourself and willing creatures within range. If this location is known to any creature not targeted by this spell, the spell fails.

The targets of this spell are bound to secrecy, unable to divulge the secret location directly or indirectly, even through spells such as @Compendium[dnd5e.spells.ppWAAEul0QHtm4er]{Detect Thoughts}. The location cannot be discovered with any divination magic. Only you can divulge the secret, and anyone you divulge it to is similarly affected by this spell.

A creature unaffected by this spell who would happen upon the secret location accidentally must make an Intelligence saving throw. On a failed save, the creature is incapable of perceiving the location, rationalizing away anything that might lead it to suspect the truth. On a successful save, the creature becomes subject to this spell.

You can dismiss this spell as an action, and the spell ends if you die. If you spend more than 1 consecutive hour in any location hidden by @Compendium[dnd5e.spells.EY65K5XJT680IQ6F]{Hide Location}, then your spell has a cumulative 5% chance of ending early every hour.

materials.value: An uncut onyx worth 5,000 gp, which the spell consumes
